product_metadata.title: ₹25 Lakh Term Insurance Plan
product_metadata.target_audience: Young persons with limited financial commitments, individuals needing specific cover

product_summary.objective: To provide financial assistance to the family in the event of the untimely demise of the life assured at a budget-friendly premium.
highlights: Tax Benefits up to ₹46,800 under Section 80C
Option to take death benefit in instalments

plan_variants.description: Pure term insurance with death benefit.
Premiums paid are refunded on maturity if the insured survives the policy tenure.

core_benefits.description: Sum assured of ₹25 Lakh paid to the nominee if the insured passes away during the policy tenure.
No benefit under normal term plans. Return of Total Premiums Paid available under Return of Premium variant.
Premiums eligible for deduction under Section 80C. Death benefit tax-free under Section 10(10D). Return of Premium tax-free subject to conditions.

policy_term_options: Whole life coverage (up to 99/100 years) available

sample_illustrations.description: Implied rate example from related pages

compliance_rules.disclaimer: Insurance is subject to terms and conditions. Please read the sales brochure and policy document carefully before purchase.
compliance_rules.fraud_warning: BEWARE of spurious phone calls and fraudulent offers. IRDAI does not sell policies or announce bonuses.
compliance_rules.tax_disclaimer: Tax benefits are subject to provisions of Section 80C and Section 10(10D) of the Income Tax Act, 1961. Consult your tax advisor.

retrieval_chunks.text: A ₹25 lakh term insurance plan offers a sum assured of ₹25 lakhs paid as death benefit. It provides financial assistance at a budget-friendly premium.
Get life cover of ₹25 Lakh at affordable rates. Suitable for young earners.
The plan offers a Return of Premium option where total premiums paid are refunded if the life assured survives the policy tenure.
Enhance coverage with riders like Critical Illness, Accidental Death Benefit, and Waiver of Premium for nominal extra cost.
Premiums are tax-deductible up to ₹1.5 lakh under Section 80C. Death benefits are tax-free under Section 10(10D).
Suitable for young persons with limited financial commitments and those needing specific cover amounts.
